qas.question: What is the required education for males on Tuvalu?
How long are females required to go to school?
What was the literacy rate on Tuvalu in 2002?
How many students were in Tuvalu schools in 2010?
What si the teacher-student ratio for Tuvalu schools?

context: Required attendance at school is <a0_0>10 years<a0_0/> for males and <a1_0>11 years<a1_0/> for females (2001). The adult literacy rate is <a2_0>99.0%<a2_0/> (2002). In 2010, there were <a3_0>1,918<a3_0/> students who were taught by 109 teachers (98 certified and 11 uncertified). The teacher-pupil ratio for primary schools in Tuvalu is around <a4_0>1:18<a4_0/> for all schools with the exception of Nauti School, which has a teacher-student ratio of 1:27. Nauti School on Funafuti is the largest primary in Tuvalu with more than 900 students (45 percent of the total primary school enrolment). The pupil-teacher ratio for Tuvalu is low compared to the Pacific region (ratio of 1:29).
